abstract: Stocks fell sharply as two disappointing economic reports outweighed good earnings reports from Goldman Sachs and Johnson & Johnson.
snippet: Stocks fell sharply as two disappointing economic reports outweighed good earnings reports from Goldman Sachs and Johnson & Johnson.
lead_paragraph: Investors on Tuesday were jolted by disappointing reports on retail sales and wholesale prices, leading to a pause in a rally that had been driven by better-than-expected economic data.

headline.main: Day of Worry on Wall Street; Shares End Lower
headline.print_headline: Sales Data Revives Worry on Wall St.

byline.original: By Jack Healy and David Jolly
